qas.question: In what year did Mali start economic changes?
Mali signed agreements with what to parties that began their economic changes?

answers.text: World Bank and the International Monetary Fund

qas.question: In what years did Mali restructure public enterprises?
How many enterprises have been made completely private since the agreement?
How many companies were completely liquidated?
What did the World Bank and international monetary fund sign with each other in 1988?
Who were formed public enterprises prior to 1988?
What did the Malain government concede to the cotton gin company?

context: <b5_0>Mali<b5_0/> underwent economic reform, beginning in <a0_0>1988<a0_0/> by signing <b6_0>agreements<b6_0/> with the <a1_0>World Bank and the International Monetary Fund<a1_0/>. During <a2_0>1988 to 1996<a2_0/>, <b7_0>Mali's government<b7_0/> largely reformed public enterprises. Since the agreement, <a3_0>sixteen <b8_0>enterprises<b8_0/><a3_0/> were privatized, 12 partially privatized, and <a4_0>20<a4_0/> liquidated. In 2005, the Malian government conceded <b9_0>a railroad company<b9_0/> to the Savage Corporation. Two major companies, Societé de Telecommunications du Mali (SOTELMA) and the Cotton Ginning Company (CMDT), were expected to be privatized in 2008.
